node.statement:
REPAIRED PROOF (addressing challenges ch-8c55446415712bd8, ch-6e958401a84a12b3, ch-e0830535105a4901):

We establish the well-definedness of the smeared Wick powers <psi, :phi^3:> and <psi^2, :phi^2:> as L^p(mu) random variables in four steps.

STEP 1 (Node 1.6.1.1 -- Field regularity, UNCHANGED): The Phi^4_3 measure mu on T^3 is supported on C^{-1/2-delta}(T^3) for every delta > 0. This is Hairer (2014) Theorem 10.7 and Barashkov-Gubinelli (2020) Theorem 1.1.

STEP 2 (Node 1.6.1.2 -- Wick power regularity, REPAIRED -- Error 3): Under mu, the renormalized Wick powers converge: (i) :phi^2: in C^{-1-delta}(T^3) for every delta > 0. (ii) :phi^3: in C^{-3/2-delta}(T^3) for every delta > 0. Convergence is mu-a.s. and in L^p(mu) for all p >= 1. REPAIR of Error 3 (reversed Besov inclusion): The original proof stated C^{-3/2-3delta} subset C^{-3/2-delta}, which is backwards since -3/2-3delta < -3/2-delta implies C^{-3/2-delta} subset C^{-3/2-3delta} (lower regularity spaces are larger). The CORRECTED argument is: In Hairer regularity structures framework (2014, Section 10), the symbol Xi^3 has homogeneity 3(-1/2-delta_0) = -3/2-3delta_0. The reconstruction theorem (Theorem 3.10) yields :phi^3: in C^{-3/2-3delta_0} for any delta_0 > 0. For any TARGET regularity index delta > 0, choose delta_0 = delta/3. Then :phi^3: in C^{-3/2-3(delta/3)} = C^{-3/2-delta}. Since delta > 0 was arbitrary, :phi^3: in C^{-3/2-delta} for every delta > 0. Analogously for :phi^2:, the reconstruction gives C^{-1-2delta_0}; choosing delta_0 = delta/2 yields C^{-1-delta} for any target delta > 0. The L^p(mu) bounds E_mu[||:phi^k:||_{C^{-k/2-delta}}^p] < infinity follow from Mourrat-Weber (2017, Proposition 3.2) and Gubinelli-Hofmanova (2019, Proposition 2.3).

STEP 3 (Node 1.6.1.3 -- Duality pairings, REPAIRED -- Error 1): Given :phi^3: in C^{-3/2-delta}(T^3) and :phi^2: in C^{-1-delta}(T^3), and psi in C^inf(T^3), the pairings are well-defined. REPAIR of Error 1 (wrong duality condition): The correct condition for the duality pairing of C^{s_1} x C^{s_2} (with s_2 < 0) to be well-defined as a continuous bilinear map is s_1 + s_2 > 0. In the notation C^alpha x C^{-beta} with alpha, beta > 0, this translates to alpha - beta > 0, i.e., alpha > beta (NOT the previously stated alpha + beta > 0, which is trivially true and proves nothing). (a) For <psi, :phi^3:>: We pair psi in C^inf subset C^{3/2+2delta} with :phi^3: in C^{-3/2-delta}. The regularity sum is (3/2+2delta) + (-3/2-delta) = delta > 0. Since delta > 0, the pairing is well-defined and continuous. Equivalently, alpha = 3/2+2delta, beta = 3/2+delta, and alpha - beta = delta > 0. (b) For <psi^2, :phi^2:>: We pair psi^2 in C^inf subset C^{1+2delta} with :phi^2: in C^{-1-delta}. The regularity sum is (1+2delta) + (-1-delta) = delta > 0. Since delta > 0, the pairing is well-defined and continuous. Measurability: These bilinear pairings are continuous, hence Borel measurable, so phi |-> <psi, :phi^3:> and phi |-> <psi^2, :phi^2:> are measurable functions from (D'(T^3), B(D'(T^3))) to (R, B(R)).

STEP 4 (Node 1.6.1.4 -- L^p integrability, REPAIRED -- Error 2): REPAIR of Error 2 (borderline duality bound): The original used ||psi||_{C^{k/2+delta}} * ||:phi^k:||_{C^{-k/2-delta}}, giving regularity sum (k/2+delta)+(-k/2-delta) = 0, which is the borderline case where the continuous bilinear estimate FAILS. CORRECTED bound: By the continuity of the duality pairing (Step 3 with strictly positive regularity gap), for k = 2, 3: |<psi, :phi^k:>| <= C_delta * ||psi||_{C^{k/2+2delta}} * ||:phi^k:||_{C^{-k/2-delta}} where C_delta is the operator norm of the bilinear pairing C^{k/2+2delta} x C^{-k/2-delta} -> R (finite since regularity sum = (k/2+2delta)+(-k/2-delta) = delta > 0). Since psi in C^inf is fixed, ||psi||_{C^{k/2+2delta}} is a finite constant. Therefore: E_mu[|<psi, :phi^k:>|^p] <= C_delta^p * ||psi||_{C^{k/2+2delta}}^p * E_mu[||:phi^k:||_{C^{-k/2-delta}}^p]. By the uniform moment bounds from Step 2 (Mourrat-Weber 2017, Proposition 3.2; Gubinelli-Hofmanova 2019, Proposition 2.3), E_mu[||:phi^k:||_{C^{-k/2-delta}}^p] < infinity for all p >= 1 and k = 2, 3. Hence <psi, :phi^k:> in L^p(mu) for all p >= 1. QED.
